result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles L Steinfest was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With huber for work, work search, treatment, or community service if defendant qualifies under jail classification system. To begin within 45 days.

Any vehicle titled or registered in defendant's name is subject to IID as is the defendant himself.
Half Priced IID

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 11:45am
State appears by ADA S.Brubacher.  Def appears in person and with Atty Julie Sawyer.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  


PLEA:
Ct. 1 (OWI 2nd)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis & def guilty

COURT ORDERS: $1700 inclusive of all costs including DNA surcharge; AODA; 60 days MCJ w/huber for work/seeking work/treatment/community service if defendant qualifies under jail classification system, to begin within 45 days, w/credit for 2 days of time served; 14 month DL Rev w/credit;   Any vehicles titled and registered in the defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant him/herself, both for a period of 14 months; IID to be installed within 14 days; $50 IID surcharge to be paid; Half-Priced IID ordered as defendant qualifies-- COURT grants request to exempt 2 vehicles as requested; DNA sample.

Adj: 11:54am

Clerk Cheree

State appears by ADA S.Brubacher. Defendant appears in person and with Atty Julie Sawyer.


Parties note agreement HAS been reached in this matter however needs to complete AODA at Attic; Parties request plea be set before FPT date.
State notes discovery has been completed.
COURT leaves FPT/JT dates on court's calendar
Bond continues.

Adj: 8:51am

Plea hearing at 10-20-2015 08:50 am.
Final pre-trial at 11-12-2015 09:00 am.
Jury Trial at 12-02-2015 08:15 am.

Shall not consume alcohol.  Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.   No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.    Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 within 5 business days of release from custody.
